meanings.definition: To prepare or make ready in advance.
meanings.sent1: I will prepave the ingredients for the cake before starting to bake.
meanings.sent2: She likes to prepave her outfit the night before school.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel decided to prepave its stash of acorns for the winter.
meanings.sent4: The teacher will prepave the lesson plan to ensure a smooth class.
meanings.sent5: It is important to prepave your route before going on a road trip.

meanings.definition: To lay the groundwork for something to happen.
meanings.sent1: The team will prepave the project timeline to avoid delays.
meanings.sent2: He wanted to prepave the path for his promotion by working hard.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to prepave the audience for his grand finale trick.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness helped prepave the way for a stronger friendship.
meanings.sent5: The community worked together to prepave a brighter future for the children.

meanings.definition: To pave or cover a surface with a material before the final layer is applied.
meanings.sent1: The workers will prepave the road with a base layer before adding asphalt.
meanings.sent2: They decided to prepave the driveway with gravel before pouring concrete.
meanings.sent3: The artist wanted to prepave the canvas with a primer before painting.
meanings.sent4: The builders will prepave the floor with tiles before installing hardwood.
meanings.sent5: It is essential to prepave the wall with a coat of paint before adding wallpaper.
